availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
State of Kentucky Calloway County Court
October Term 1860

This Court doth reccommend to his Excellency the Govenor of this Commonwealth Francis. U. Dodds and as fit and proper persons one of whom to be commissioned a Justice of the peace for this county to fill the vacancy occasioned by the resignation and removal from the County of Isaiah,, R.. Miller late a justice of the peace for the 5th district in this county
A Copy attest P. M. Ellison. C. C. C. C.

Thos B Monre Esqr
Frankfort Ky,
Dear Sir.

You will find above a recommendation for a Justice of the peace, it is imported that you attend to the matter and send on a commission as early as is convenient for you to do so, there is not another man in the district that would consent to have the office is the cause of the blanks in the order.

Calloway
J. P. Dist No 5
F. U. Dodds
vice
J. R. Miller
Issd Nov 17, 1860
